meanings.definition: A buoyant or inflatable device worn around the waist to aid in staying afloat in water.
meanings.sent1: The sailor put on his lifebelts before going out to sea.
meanings.sent2: It is important to have lifebelts on board in case of emergencies.
meanings.sent3: The playful otter mistook the lifebelts for a fun toy.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a lifebelt, keeping everyone afloat in the sea of sadness.
meanings.sent5: The bright orange color of the lifebelts made them easy to spot in the water.

meanings.definition: A ring or band of material used to support or protect someone in danger of drowning.
meanings.sent1: The lifebelts were thrown to the struggling swimmer in the nick of time.
meanings.sent2: The lifeguard always carries extra lifebelts just in case.
meanings.sent3: The lifebelts doubled as fashionable accessories for the beachgoers.
meanings.sent4: Her words were a lifebelt of encouragement in his time of need.
meanings.sent5: The lifebelts encircled them like a protective shield against the raging waves.
